data.description: The Broken Sphere
data.creator: Nigel Findley

data.description: It is named for the great amount of fighting that is done within the sphere.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: It is named for the great oceans that lie within space itself.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: The sphere of the Dark Sun campign
data.creator: TSR/Adam Miller

data.description: It is named due to the greater spelljamming capabilities ships recieve upon entering it.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Sphere half-full of water, near Vodoni Empire
data.creator: KrazyIvan

data.description: Horrorspace was once called peacespace. It's current name is due to the fact that Clockwork Horros devouered the entire innards of the sphere.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: It is named for the state that all the planets are in... torn up.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Origin of Clockwork Horrors
data.creator: TSR

info.name: World of the Lost Ones
info.source: MC7 Monstrous Compendium Spelljammer Appendix. Dragon #350, page 59.

data.description: Filled with viscous fluid, hostle inhabitants.
data.creator: Valdrax

data.description: It is named due to the Elemental nature of its planets.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: "Tarraspace is a sphere in which almost all normal magic, psionics, elements and even conventional physics has broken down. Antimatter particles swirl in the central area where once a solar body existed, and the sole habitable surviving planet is infested with an entire race of Tarrasques as well as Athas-style Dragons, demonspwan, slimes and every kind of monster. The nickname of this sphere is ""The Gods' Graveyard""."
data.creator: Trudi Molenaar

data.description: Infested crystal sphere

Nacrespace (aka Pearlspace) is a flooded crystal sphere. Approximately a third of its total volume consists of air, but the sphere actually resembles a goldfish bowl with a top. The worlds swirl around the central elemental sapphire jewel sun which heats the waters to bearable temperatures.
data.creator: Trudi Molenaar

data.description: [central campaign setting for BTFS campaign]
data.creator: Trudi Molenaar

data.description: Origin of Witchlight Marauders, 5 months from Casaspace
data.creator: Noah Bonebrake

data.description: Formally frozen, comet-filled sphere (aka. Icespace).
data.creator: Archlich

data.description: Cluster of 6 spheres
data.creator: Nigel Findley

data.description: It is named for the light blue color of the sky. This is due to the millions of Blue stars that light up the dark regions of the sphere.
data.creator: Nigel Findly/Rovion

data.description: The home sphere of the Atridae, a race of dragonfly creatures. Sealed by the Juna, it can only be reached by the use of an Ethereal Key.
data.creator: Trudi Molenaar

data.description: The Nuthutch as it has been unkindly called
A member of the Pentiacate
data.creator: Richard J. Pugh

data.description: A member of the Pentiacate
data.creator: Eric F. Schetley

data.description: 'Geode' sphere with no planets. A member of the Pentiacate

data.description: It is named for the rainbow colored stars that line the sphere.

data.description: Scro Home Sphere
data.creator: TSR/Sable

data.description: It is named so because of the difficult time sailors have in finding it.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Upon entering Rainspace the spacefarer will immediately understand the naming of this sphere. It is alway raining even in the depths of wildspace. One of the planets called Zenuvia is famous for its gargantuan flytraps capable of swallowing small spelljammers!
data.creator: "George ""Loki"" Williams"

data.description: Dead sphere
data.creator: Archlich

data.description: Its name comes from the destroyed planet of Nex which had such terrible evil upon it.
data.creator: Nigel Findly/Rovion

data.description: It is the central headquarters for the Commonrule. It gets its name from the great portal that transports ships to Outspace.

data.description: It gets its name for it is the sphere where all the best technologies and craftsmen come to learn, trade, and sell. he
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: It is named for the great weakened fissure that leads to Temporal Prime somewhere within the sphere.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: (aka. Nexspace)

data.description: It is named for a hero of the Kr'r'r confrontation, the Dark Ranger Bloodstar, brother to Firestorm, who was essential in the salvation of Roaving Star.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Cubespace is a small sphere that gets it's name from it's central sun, which is oddly enough in the shape of a giant cube.
data.creator: Jordan Silverton

data.description: It is called such because of the planet Sword, and the two great starbeasts who will someday use planets Sword and Helm to fight.
data.creator: Rovion

info.name: Parcelius
info.notes: likely a fairly cosmopolitan, spelljammer-aware world.

data.description: Goblin sphere conquered by scro
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: There are two primary governmental factions warring for control of the sphere. The first faction is the Duntharan Empire--Hurmus, Stattoo, and Agmar. Consists primarily of humans and demi-humans allied to stop the conquest of their enemies. The second faction is the Volarin Empire--Grothag, Calim, and Tallin. Consists primarily of Viking Beserkers who seek relentlessly to conquer the sphere.
data.creator: Ryland Spicer

data.description: From Under the Dark Fist
data.creator: TSR

data.description: From Under the Dark Fist
data.creator: TSR

data.description: Jadespace is one of the older known Spheres. Ancient artifacts of the Juna can still be found within the crystal sphere. It is one of the most diverse spheres known for all walks of life and any know spelljamming race can be found here.
data.creator: Jordan Silverton

data.description: Webspace is actually two spheres in one. Both co-exist with one another, seperated by a magical curtain
data.creator: Kevin Scardino & Jonathan Stevenson

data.description: Webspace is actually two spheres in one. Both co-exist with one another, seperated by a magical curtain
data.creator: Kevin Scardino & Jonathan Stevenson

data.description: Dark & Dangerous Sphere
data.creator: Enildarion

info.name: Blacksea
info.notes: 4 moons (Dead Reef, Orb, The Web, Elamshin D'lil Yorn)

data.description: It is named due to upon entering the sphere, one appears in the orbit of Gainiiaaon. The crystal shell is actually a month away, toward the Wee One, at spelljamming speed. Portals open within Gainiiaaon to allow for exit. also known as Compspace.
data.creator: Nigel Findly/Rovion

data.description: "Features in ""The Broken Sphere"" (TCMC5 p.16)"
data.creator: Nigel Findley

info.name: The Heart
info.notes: "Heartspace's enormous primary ""beats"" (giving the sphere its name), pulsing from dark to light slowly within the space of about ten minutes. It is a deep red star, otherwise as typical as any other. This sun is one of the largest of all the spheres."

data.description: Sphere containing the Bandor Cluster.

The crystal sphere is much larger than it should be, given that it houses only one celestial body. The entire Crystal Sphere is filled with millions upon millions of iridescent particles. The particles all glow with bright radiance akin to the stars of a night sky. They vary in size from that of a grain of sand to a small asteroid. These particles will pass freely through a ship's air envelope and settle upon the ship itself. When the ship leaves the crystal sphere it will glow with a radiance similar t
data.creator: Max Currier

data.description: Dominated by Thr-Kreen and Xixchil (see Thri-Kreen of Athas p.84)
data.creator: TSR

info.notes: The Xixchil's homeworld is a live world with many predators.

data.description: Beltoun to Taul = 45 days, Taul to S'Sirenth = 35 days, Beltoun from Calatain = 35 days, Beltoun to Claatain = 50 days

data.description: Center of the Maelstrom and thus visited by many spelljammers. Twilitespace is both the hub of trade and the center of civilization for the entire Maelstrom. Elves, humans, giants, and goblins were all born in this sphere. also known as Twilightspace.
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: Small, remote sphere
On Hammer flow, 50 days from S'Sirenth, 35 days from Taul
PC's homeworld in Monsterous Arcana modules

data.description: IEN home base

data.description: Elven dominated sphere from Polyhedron #81
data.creator: TSR

data.description: Sphere is briefly mentioned in Dragon Issue 175, page 4. An elven controlled sphere known for its gargantuan thorn worlds Bramble and Briar. Scro and Illithids sometimes attempt to scout it (at great peril) on the assumption it is the choise location for Lionheart. Non-elves are not tolerated within the sphere and a war-clan of loyal Bionoids is always on the ready to help enforce the elven claim. A major resupply station of the IEN is located within the branches of Bramble. Many smaller elven communiti
data.creator: TSR/Terry Hawkins

data.description: This sphere is famous for it's gemstone sun and the homeworld of the dwarves. Countless asteriods, minor worlds, and gas giants are home to numerous and diverse civilizations.
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: "The ""Place of Tears,"" Tyrspace's civilizations was shaped centuries ago by evil Raer sorcerers, who used it as a testing ground for their experiments. From those experiments were born the centaurs, satyrs, and minotaurs."
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: A hot, dry sphere that was once the center of a great illithid empire. New civilizations have risen from the ashes of the fallen empire seeking their own destinies. Great danger and incredible wealth awaits those that dare delve into the secrets of Banesun.
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: Once the center of the Raer Empire and many relics from that shattered empire remain. The world of Pale is long thought the lost capital of the Raer, but it was nearly destroyed during the Rage of the Emperor. Descendants of the Raer continue to survive but have fallen into barbarism.
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: "aka. Bralspace, Spiralspace, or Morunespace featured in ""The Maelstrom's Eye"" by Roger E. Moore"
data.creator: Nigel Findley, Adam Miller, Paul Westermeyer

data.description: The sphere is named so because anyone born within the sphere is charmed so as to not want to leave.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Water-filled sphere
data.creator: Enildarion

data.description: near 'Malspace
Origin of assoritid psychic worms
data.creator: ripvanwormer

data.description: It is named for the planets.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Civilization is young in Pearlspace, immigrating from other spheres. Strange and unusual worlds abound, strangest of all the gigantic dragon who's fiery breath lights and heats the whole sphere.
data.creator: Adam Miller

data.description: Largest and wildest sphere in the Maelstrom and home to endless herds of kindori and other space-born creatures. The famous Travelling City, built upon the back of a gigantic, space-travelling whale ten miles long, wanders this sphere.
data.creator: Adam Miller
Adam Miller, Paul Westermeyer, Rian McMurty

data.description: Dirkspace is named for its three planets that look very akin to blades.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Racespace is a sphere that was started many millenia ago. It was hoped that humans and demihumans could get along if they shared a sphere but kept to their own planets. Unfortunetly, they were forgotten.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: 35 days inside innerflow (to, 36 days from)

data.creator: Pscion

data.description: Birthright Sphere
data.creator: TSR/Ian Hoskins

data.description: Its name comes from the unusual noise that every sailor can hear while in the sphere.
data.creator: Nigel Findly/Rovion

data.description: "This sphere is home to the greatest of Wyrm-sages, Ocrattafarsmythe, a Golden Great Wyrm. It was given to him as a gift from a dragon god with the understanding that he must aid any dragon kind which came to him for wisdom. There is a direct portal to this sphere located in every Crystal Sphere that has a ""dragon"" constellation in it."
data.creator: Max Currier

data.description: Sphere containing a giant tree
data.creator: Rupert Smith

data.description: "The sphere holds the Talangran Empire, a spelljamming aware groundling nation with superior technology and a thirst for Elven slaves. In my campaign the Talangran Empire has begun to expand into the stars. Inspired by ""The Lady Rose"" Dungeon #39(?)"
data.creator: TSR

info.name: Talangran
info.notes: This planet holds the Talangran Empire, a spelljamming aware groundling nation with superior technology and a thirst for Elven slaves.

data.description: Wayspace is a sphere mentioned during the Spelljammer book series. Teldin says that he comes from Lyi in Wayspace, which is a farming colony. This sphere comes from book 2.
data.creator: TSR/Rovion

data.description: Due to the prescence of the many fire bodies of the sphere the temperature of the void is considerably higher than in any other sphere. It borders on uncomfortable near the shell and as a vessel draws near the center it becomes impossible to endure without protection.
data.creator: Max Currier

data.description: It receives its name in that the chaos emeralds come from this sphere.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Its name was given due to the Great Expansion of 175BR when spelljammers charged into the sphere. It is a sphere of mercinaries and law.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: What is Dungeonsphere? Dungeonsphere is the largest dungeon in all of known space. The size of this dungeon is not measured easily. Why is this? This is because Dungeonsphere is not on a planet, it is within a crystal sphere. So it is just on a large planet then? No it is the crystal sphere itself.

info.name: Ghenrek IV / Gaia
info.notes: Home of Wilderlands of High Fantasy setting

data.description: It is named so because of the antimagic effects of the planet's atmospheres. Spelljammers who enter these atmospheres... fall.
data.creator: Rovion

data.description: Mystaran Cluster: Inner Sphere (Near Mystara)
data.creator: John Calvin (Chimpman)

data.description: Record of Lodoss War setting
data.creator: Group SNE

data.description: "Each of the planets in this sphere houses many civilizations of brownie-like humanoids. These tiny beings mimic the many races of a large world, but are only a few inches tall at most. The geography of the planets is tiny as well, with the tallest mountains being several hundered feet tall at most. A tree would stand approximately a foot or two at most. ""Normal"" characters are verifiable titans to these people, and may not even notice the tiny people which exist on the surface of these worlds."
data.creator: Max Currier

data.description: It is named so because of the thousands of small live bearing asteroids scattered throughout the sphere. A great vacation spot or retirement land.
data.creator: Nigel Findly/Rovion

data.description: Home of Draconia campaign setting
data.creator: Sable

info.name: Aurel
info.notes: Gate to elemental plane of fire

data.description: Trailspace (aka Pathspace) is named for the path the great planet takes within the sphere.

data.description: The world of the Thieves' World anthologies is in this sphere. I think the Nisibis, at least, are Spelljammer aware.

data.description: Runequest Campaign World
Located away from any major rivers this was only recently discovered by an Elven Man-o-War. Only artifact level magic (like Helms) and spells up to 2nd level function here.
data.creator: Paul Westermeyer

data.description: Accessing this sphere from the flow is easy, however, leaving it can prove to be difficult. There are numerous one-way portals leading out of the sphere within the constellations of the Crystal Shell. The locations of these portals shift and change randomly from star to star.
data.creator: Max Currier

data.description: Latierraspace is mainly held by the spelljamming fleet of Amnestriosti, which is also unusually large (somewhere around 3000 ships...), but the other planets have some monopolies on the Spelljamming market.
data.creator: Daniel Sheff

info.notes: 7 moons (Hecate, Math Mathonwy, O-Kuni-Nushi, Isis, Soma, Mon, Sehaine/Eilistraee)

data.description: It recieves its name due to the great amounts of sand that are scattered throughout space, causing fearce storms and undue wear and tear on spelljamming vessels.

data.description: Its name was derived by the EIN inorder to easily allow diplomats and forien dignitaries to find the correct planets durring times of peace and truce. Countspace is the heart of the Elven Imperial Navy.
